page.description: Change the names of fields in a table without restructuring the table.
page.original:
TABLE.FIELDNAME_CHANGE() Syntax TABLE.FIELDNAME_CHANGE( Table_Filename as C, Old_Fields as C, New_Fields as C ) ArgumentDescription Table_FilenameThe fully qualified file name of the table. Old_FieldsA CR-LF delimited list of old field names. New_FieldsA CR-LF delimited list of new field names.
Description The TABLE.FIELDNAME_CHANGE() function allows you to change field names through Xbasic. Important: If any of the fields whose name you change are included in any index expressions, those indexes will be dropped. Note : Alpha Anywhere pads the new field name with spaces to a length of 10 characters. Examples dim old_names as C dim new_names as C old_names = "ID" + crlf()+ "Reference" new_names = "ID_Seealso" + crlf()+ "Description" table.fieldname_change("C:\Databases\Help_Database\Seealso.Dbf", old_names, new_names)
See Also Table Functions and Methods
